content:
_Assembly Interface

In this Article

Exposes the public members of the Assembly class to unmanaged code.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.CLSCompliant(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("17156360-2f1a-384a-bc52-fde93c215c5b")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsDual)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibImportClass(typeof(System.Reflection.Assembly))]
public interface _Assembly

Remarks

This interface is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

This interface preserves the vtable order of the System.Reflection.Assembly class members that can be accessed by unmanaged COM objects.

Properties summary

CodeBase

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.CodeBase* property.
EntryPoint

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.EntryPoint* property.
EscapedCodeBase

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.EscapedCodeBase* property.

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.Evidence* property.
FullName

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.FullName* property.
GlobalAssemblyCache

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GlobalAssemblyCache* property.
Location

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.Location* property.

ModuleResolve

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the ModuleResolve event.

Properties

  • CodeBase

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.CodeBase* property.

    public string CodeBase { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The location of the assembly as specified originally.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The CodeBase property gets the location of the assembly as specified originally, for example, in an AssemblyName object.

  • EntryPoint

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.EntryPoint* property.

    public System.Reflection.MethodInfo EntryPoint { get; }

    Property Value

    • MethodInfo

      A MethodInfo object that represents the entry point of this assembly. If no entry point is found (for example, the assembly is a DLL), null is returned.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The EntryPoint property gets the entry point of this assembly.

  • EscapedCodeBase

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.EscapedCodeBase* property.

    public string EscapedCodeBase { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) with escape characters.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The EscapedCodeBase property gets the URI, including escape characters, that represents the codebase.

  • Evidence

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.Evidence* property.

    public System.Security.Policy.Evidence Evidence { get; }

    Property Value

    • Evidence

      An Evidence object for this assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The Evidence property gets the evidence for this assembly.

  • FullName

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.FullName* property.

    public string FullName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The display name of the assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The FullName property gets the display name of the assembly.

  • GlobalAssemblyCache

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GlobalAssemblyCache* property.

    public bool GlobalAssemblyCache { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the assembly was loaded from the global assembly cache; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GlobalAssemblyCache property gets a value indicating whether the assembly was loaded from the global assembly cache.

  • Location

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.Location* property.

    public string Location { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The location of the loaded file that contains the manifest. If the loaded file was shadow-copied, the location is that of the file after being shadow-copied. If the assembly is loaded from a byte array, such as when using the [Load(Byte<xref href="stem.Reflection.Assembly.Load%28System.Byte%5B%5D%29"> method overload, the value returned is an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The Location property gets the path or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) location of the loaded file that contains the manifest.

Methods

  • CreateInstance(String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.CreateInstance* method.

    public object CreateInstance (string typeName);

    Parameters

    • typeName
      String

      The stem.Type.FullName* of the type to locate.

    Returns

    • Object

      An instance of Object representing the type, with culture, arguments, binder, and activation attributes set to null, and BindingFlags set to Public or Instance, or null if typeName is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The CreateInstance method locates the specified type from this assembly and creates an instance of it using the system activator, using case-sensitive search.

  • CreateInstance(String,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.CreateInstance* method.

    public object CreateInstance (string typeName, bool ignoreCase);

    Parameters

    • typeName
      String

      The stem.Type.FullName* of the type to locate.

    • ignoreCase
      Boolean

      true to ignore the case of the type name; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • Object

      An instance of Object representing the type, with culture, arguments, binder, and activation attributes set to null, and BindingFlags set to Public or Instance, or null if typeName is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The CreateInstance method locates the specified type from this assembly and creates an instance of it using the system activator, with optional case-sensitive search.

  • CreateInstance(String,Boolean,BindingFlags,Binder,Object[],CultureInfo,Object[])

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.CreateInstance* method.

    public object CreateInstance (string typeName, bool ignoreCase, System.Reflection.BindingFlags bindingAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, object[] args, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object[] activationAttributes);

    Parameters

    • typeName
      String

      The stem.Type.FullName* of the type to locate.

    • ignoreCase
      Boolean

      true to ignore the case of the type name; otherwise, false.

    • bindingAttr
      BindingFlags

      A bitmask that affects how the search is conducted. The value is a combination of bit flags from BindingFlags.

    • binder
      Binder

      An object that enables the binding, coercion of argument types, invocation of members, and retrieval of MemberInfo objects via reflection. If binder is null, the default binder is used.

    • args
      Object[]

      An array of type Object containing the arguments to be passed to the constructor. This array of arguments must match in number, order, and type the parameters of the constructor to be invoked. If the default constructor is desired, args must be an empty array or null.

    • culture
      CultureInfo

      An instance of CultureInfo used to govern the coercion of types. If this is null, the CultureInfo for the current thread is used. (This is necessary to convert a String that represents 1000 to a Double value, for example, since 1000 is represented differently by different cultures.)

    • activationAttributes
      Object[]

      An array of type Object containing one or more activation attributes that can participate in the activation. An example of an activation attribute is:

      URLAttribute(http://hostname/appname/objectURI)

    Returns

    • Object

      An instance of Object representing the type and matching the specified criteria, or null if typeName is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The CreateInstance method locates the specified type from this assembly and creates an instance of it using the system activator, with optional case-sensitive search and having the specified culture, arguments, and binding and activation attributes.

  • Equals(Object)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.Equals* method.

    public bool Equals (object other);

    Parameters

    • other
      Object

      The Object to compare with the current Object.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified Object is equal to the current Object; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The Equals method determines whether the specified Object is equal to the current Object.

  • GetCustomAttributes(Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetCustomAttributes* method.

    public object[] GetCustomAttributes (bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • inherit
      Boolean

      This argument is ignored for objects of type Assembly.

    Returns

    • Object[]

      An array of type Object containing the custom attributes for this assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetCustomAttributes method gets all the custom attributes for this assembly.

  • GetCustomAttributes(Type,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetCustomAttributes* method.

    public object[] GetCustomAttributes (Type attributeType, bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • attributeType
      Type

      The Type for which the custom attributes are to be returned.

    • inherit
      Boolean

      This argument is ignored for objects of type Assembly.

    Returns

    • Object[]

      An array of type Object containing the custom attributes for this assembly as specified by attributeType.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetCustomAttributes method gets all the custom attributes for this assembly.

  • GetExportedTypes()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetExportedTypes* property.

    public Type[] GetExportedTypes ();

    Returns

    • Type[]

      An array of Type objects that represent the types defined in this assembly that are visible outside the assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetExportedTypes property gets the exported types defined in this assembly that are visible outside the assembly.

  • GetFile(String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetFile* method.

    public System.IO.FileStream GetFile (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the specified file. Do not include the path to the file.

    Returns

    • FileStream

      A FileStream for the specified file, or null if the file is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetFile method gets a FileStream for the specified file in the file table of the manifest of this assembly.

  • GetFiles()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetFiles* method.

    public System.IO.FileStream[] GetFiles ();

    Returns

    • FileStream[]

      An array of FileStream objects.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetFiles method gets the files in the file table of an assembly manifest.

  • GetFiles(Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetFiles* method.

    public System.IO.FileStream[] GetFiles (bool getResourceModules);

    Parameters

    • getResourceModules
      Boolean

      true to include resource modules; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • FileStream[]

      An array of FileStream objects.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetFiles method gets the files in the file table of an assembly manifest, specifying whether to include resource modules.

  • GetHashCode()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetHashCode* method.

    public int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code for the current Object.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetHashCode method serves as a hash function for a particular type. GetHashCode is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

  • GetLoadedModules()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetLoadedModules* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module[] GetLoadedModules ();

    Returns

    • Module[]

      An array of modules.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetLoadedModules method gets all the loaded modules that are part of this assembly.

  • GetLoadedModules(Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetLoadedModules* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module[] GetLoadedModules (bool getResourceModules);

    Parameters

    • getResourceModules
      Boolean

      true to include resource modules; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • Module[]

      An array of modules.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetLoadedModules method gets all the loaded modules that are part of this assembly, specifying whether to include resource modules.

  • GetManifestResourceInfo(String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetManifestResourceInfo* method.

    public System.Reflection.ManifestResourceInfo GetManifestResourceInfo (string resourceName);

    Parameters

    • resourceName
      String

      The case-sensitive name of the resource.

    Returns

    • ManifestResourceInfo

      A ManifestResourceInfo object populated with information about the resource's topology, or null if the resource is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetManifestResourceInfo method returns information about how the given resource has been persisted.

  • GetManifestResourceNames()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetManifestResourceNames* method.

    public string[] GetManifestResourceNames ();

    Returns

    • String[]

      An array of type String containing the names of all the resources.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetManifestResourceNames method returns the names of all the resources in this assembly.

  • GetManifestResourceStream(String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetManifestResourceStream* method.

    public System.IO.Stream GetManifestResourceStream (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The case-sensitive name of the manifest resource being requested.

    Returns

    • Stream

      A Stream representing this manifest resource.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetManifestResourceStream method loads the specified manifest resource from this assembly.

  • GetManifestResourceStream(Type,String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetManifestResourceStream* method.

    public System.IO.Stream GetManifestResourceStream (Type type, string name);

    Parameters

    • type
      Type

      The type whose namespace is used to scope the manifest resource name.

    • name
      String

      The case-sensitive name of the manifest resource being requested.

    Returns

    • Stream

      A Stream representing this manifest resource.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetManifestResourceStream method loads the specified manifest resource, scoped by the namespace of the specified type, from this assembly.

  • GetModule(String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetModule* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module GetModule (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the module being requested.

    Returns

    • Module

      The module being requested, or null if the module is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetModule method gets the specified module in this assembly.

  • GetModules()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetModules* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module[] GetModules ();

    Returns

    • Module[]

      An array of modules.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetModules method gets all the modules that are part of this assembly.

  • GetModules(Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetModules* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module[] GetModules (bool getResourceModules);

    Parameters

    • getResourceModules
      Boolean

      true to include resource modules; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • Module[]

      An array of modules.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetModules method gets all the modules that are part of this assembly, specifying whether to include resource modules.

  • GetName()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetName* method.

    public System.Reflection.AssemblyName GetName ();

    Returns

    • AssemblyName

      An AssemblyName for this assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetName method gets an AssemblyName for this assembly.

  • GetName(Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetName* method.

    public System.Reflection.AssemblyName GetName (bool copiedName);

    Parameters

    • copiedName
      Boolean

      true to set the stem.Reflection.Assembly.CodeBase* to the location of the assembly after it was shadow copied; false to set stem.Reflection.Assembly.CodeBase* to the original location.

    Returns

    • AssemblyName

      An AssemblyName for this assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetName method gets an AssemblyName for this assembly, setting the codebase as specified by the copiedName parameter.

  • GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetObjectData* method.

    public void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);

    Parameters

    • info
      SerializationInfo

      The object to be populated with serialization information.

    • context
      StreamingContext

      The destination context of the serialization.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetObjectData method gets serialization information with all of the data needed to reinstantiate this assembly.

  • GetReferencedAssemblies()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetReferencedAssemblies* method.

    public System.Reflection.AssemblyName[] GetReferencedAssemblies ();

    Returns

    • AssemblyName[]

      An array of type AssemblyName containing all the assemblies referenced by this assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetReferencedAssemblies method gets the AssemblyName objects for all the assemblies referenced by this assembly.

  • GetSatelliteAssembly(CultureInfo)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetSatelliteAssembly* method.

    public System.Reflection.Assembly GetSatelliteAssembly (System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture);

    Parameters

    • culture
      CultureInfo

      The specified culture.

    Returns

    • Assembly

      The specified satellite assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetSatelliteAssembly method gets the satellite assembly for the specified culture.

  • GetSatelliteAssembly(CultureInfo,Version)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetSatelliteAssembly* method.

    public System.Reflection.Assembly GetSatelliteAssembly (System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, Version version);

    Parameters

    • culture
      CultureInfo

      The specified culture.

    • version
      Version

      The version of the satellite assembly.

    Returns

    • Assembly

      The specified satellite assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetSatelliteAssembly method gets the specified version of the satellite assembly for the specified culture.

  • GetType()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetType* method.

    public Type GetType ();

    Returns

    • Type

      A Type object.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetType method gets the type of the current instance.

  • GetType(String)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetType* method.

    public Type GetType (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The full name of the type.

    Returns

    • Type

      A Type object that represents the specified class, or null if the class is not found.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetType method gets the Type object with the specified name in the assembly instance.

  • GetType(String,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetType* method.

    public Type GetType (string name, bool throwOnError);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The full name of the type.

    • throwOnError
      Boolean

      true to throw an exception if the type is not found; false to return null.

    Returns

    • Type

      A Type object that represents the specified class.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetType method gets the Type object with the specified name in the assembly instance and optionally throws an exception if the type is not found.

  • GetType(String,Boolean,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetType* method.

    public Type GetType (string name, bool throwOnError, bool ignoreCase);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The full name of the type.

    • throwOnError
      Boolean

      true to throw an exception if the type is not found; false to return null.

    • ignoreCase
      Boolean

      true to ignore the case of the type name; otherwise, false.

    Returns

    • Type

      A Type object that represents the specified class.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetType method gets the Type object with the specified name in the assembly instance, with the options of ignoring the case, and of throwing an exception if the type is not found.

  • GetTypes()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes* method.

    public Type[] GetTypes ();

    Returns

    • Type[]

      An array of type Type containing objects for all the types defined in this assembly.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetTypes method gets the types defined in this assembly.

  • IsDefined(Type,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.IsDefined* method.

    public bool IsDefined (Type attributeType, bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • attributeType
      Type

      The Type of the custom attribute to be checked for this assembly.

    • inherit
      Boolean

      This argument is ignored for objects of this type.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if a custom attribute identified by the specified Type is defined; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsDefined method indicates whether a custom attribute identified by the specified Type is defined.

  • LoadModule(String,Byte[])

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.LoadModule* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module LoadModule (string moduleName, byte[] rawModule);

    Parameters

    • moduleName
      String

      Name of the module. Must correspond to a file name in this assembly's manifest.

    • rawModule
      Byte[]

      A byte array that is a COFF-based image containing an emitted module, or a resource.

    Returns

    • Module

      The loaded Module.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The LoadModule method loads the module, internal to this assembly, with a Common Object File Format (COFF)-based image containing an emitted module, or a resource file.

  • LoadModule(String,Byte[],Byte[])

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.LoadModule* method.

    public System.Reflection.Module LoadModule (string moduleName, byte[] rawModule, byte[] rawSymbolStore);

    Parameters

    • moduleName
      String

      Name of the module. Must correspond to a file name in this assembly's manifest.

    • rawModule
      Byte[]

      A byte array that is a COFF-based image containing an emitted module, or a resource.

    • rawSymbolStore
      Byte[]

      A byte array containing the raw bytes representing the symbols for the module. Must be null if this is a resource file.

    Returns

    • Module

      The loaded module.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The LoadModule method loads the module, internal to this assembly, with a Common Object File Format (COFF)-based image containing an emitted module, or a resource file. The raw bytes representing the symbols for the module are also loaded.

  • ToString()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.Assembly.ToString* method.

    public string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      The full name of the assembly, or the class name if the full name of the assembly cannot be determined.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The ToString method returns the full name of the assembly, also known as the display name.

Events

  • ModuleResolve

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the ModuleResolve event.

    public event System.Reflection.ModuleResolveEventHandler ModuleResolve;

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The ModuleResolve event occurs when the common language runtime class loader cannot resolve a reference to an internal module of an assembly through normal means.
